1:
Six groups each containing at least 2 tiles of the same type.
The tiles of one group can be different from those of another group.
2: Four tiles of the same type in the four corners of the bookshelf.
3:
Four groups each containing at least 4 tiles of the same type.
The tiles of one group can be different from those of another group.
4:
Two groups each containing 4 tiles of the same type, shaped exactly like a 2x2 square.
The tiles of the two squares must be of the same type. Every tile close to the square must be of a different type.
5:
Three columns each formed by 6 tiles of maximum three different types.
One column can show the same or a different combination of another column.
6: Eight tiles of the same type. Thereâ€™s no restriction about the position of these tiles.
7: Five tiles of the same type forming a diagonal.
8:
Four rows each formed by 5 tiles of up to three different types.
Each row's tiles combination may or may not be different from the others.
9: Two columns each formed by 6 different types of tiles.
10: Two rows each formed by 5 different types of tiles. Tiles can be different between the two rows
11: Five tiles of the same type forming an X.
12:
Five columns of increasing or decreasing height. Starting from the first column on the left or on the right,
each next column must be made of exactly one more tile. Tiles can be of any type.
